isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - TO RAISE CAB

step1.para: Park vehicle on level surface so there will be a minimum of frame twist.
Place transmission in neutral, set parking brake and shut off engine.
Remove or secure loose objects inside of cab and sleeper compartment.
Close cab doors and storage compartment doors.
Check clearances above and in front of cab ( Figure 6).
Place cab lift control lever in "RAISE" position ( Figure 7).
Raise cab. Manually pump cab lift pump, or if air assisted, press button on the side of the air motor to operate pump ( Figure 8).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. INSERT PUMP HANDLE FOR MANUAL OPERATION
4. PRESS AIR CONTROL BUTTON TO RAISE CAB
5. FITTING FOR ATTACHING EXTERNAL AIR SOURCE

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with air operated pump and the air system does not have enough air pressure to lift the cab, there is an external air fitting on the air pump (Item 5, Figure 8). Air from another source can be fed into the system to operate the cab lift air pump.

step2.para: Partial tilt and engaging alternate safety prop ( Figure 9).

note.para: When tilting cab partially, ALWAYS support the cab with a safety prop. Use a suitable alternate prop such as a piece of 4x4 wood or a 1 1/2 inch or larger diameter steel pipe cut to a suitable length. Place the safety prop into the cab latch pad and up into the cab tunnel area behind the cab back panel ( Figure 9). Be sure that the safety prop is securely seated at both ends. Also be careful not to place the prop end that will fit up into the cab tunnel area on any of the air and hydraulic lines that are routed in that area. Carefully lower cab slightly, just to have a small amount of pressure on the safety prop, and to hold the prop in position. Then put cab tilt pump lever to RAISE position and pump handle just to the point when the cab starts to lift.

step2.para: Full tilt and engaging ram safety prop ( Figure 10).
